alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 30 at 10:16PM MDT until April 02 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations between 9 and 14 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph on exposed mountain ridges. * WHERE...Lookout Pass. * WHEN...From Friday evening through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Motorists planning to drive over Lookout Pass on Interstate 90 should prepared for winter driving conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The late season sun angle will contribute to higher accumulation efficiency for snow that falls overnight and early in the morning. Snowfall rates up to an inch per hour and falling temperatures late Friday night and early Saturday morning will increase the potential for winter driving conditions.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
